messages: dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (00:20): anyone know the channel thats specifically for mobile web dev ?
3fa179c2d34f53c18e7551ac493014d9 (00:27): i think one of the major goals of html5 is to be accessible by mobile devices, so you can probably just ask your mobile questions here
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:28): the goal of web standards is to be accessable from any device by any one
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (00:28): basically i have a mobile site that i've been working on that works great in portrait mode but when the phone is flipped to landscape its kind of off
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:28): use media queries
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (00:30): i know if i recode the site to use % instead of px it will just work
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (00:30): ill look into media queries thanks
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (00:35): Hi div

38e5971429bb0f30aa410ac1ae0bb9a9 (00:35): (98 hours 10 mins ago) &lt 2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e> tell bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 I got a node backbone thing running already for that project!
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (00:35): clearly botty did not do its job right!
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (00:35): Sweet
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (00:35): bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8: just commented on the issue.
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (00:35): bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8: there are some more things that could be done, if you are interested.
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (00:36): 1. link to instacss or spec deets on each property.
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (00:36): 2. iframe insert data from caniuse.com for each property.
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (00:36): 3. remove the code that paul_irish_ wrote for search and use list.js for that.
41fe5fd46500b2b37dd2d02f58c574c9 (00:38): http://html5zombo.com/

bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (00:39): 2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e: Hmm, caniuse has % support data, but I was referring to marketshare data.  Like, 60% of users have a browser that supports border-radius
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (00:40): bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8: it has that data too
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (00:40): Nice
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (00:40): like you can even customize it these days to your domain
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (00:40): its pretty good.
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (00:40): there might or might not be an api.
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (00:41): Wow, cool, I never played with this part of the site before
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (00:42): I don't get all the rage vs jquip, I'm not going to use it, but the idea of a modular codebase is not bad
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (00:42): I like the "import statistics" feature quite a bit

bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (00:55): 2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e: Doesn't look like there would be a way to sort features by public exposure with this approach - aside from screen scraping, which is iffy
